text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with how to fix a broken
hollandaise it's really easy
I had an eggs benedict Florentine style
down at the Santa Maria in and it
reminded me of this little trick there
it is
a broken hollandaise is there anything
is ugly the butter has separated from
the egg it is something that 99% of the
cooks in the world will throw away and
start over and this happens to line
cooks it's always like that last order
of eggs benedict at the restaurant and
you go to put the sauce on and the sauce
is broken in you you say something like
anyway here's how you fix it so easy
take a warm stainless steel bowl run it
under hot water and dry it out and then
dump in a half a tablespoon of boiling
water now usually I'm doing this for
larger batches I'm just going to fix a
really small one here all I had leftover
so I'm only going to use about half a
tablespoon of boiling water so you dump
the water in and then you slowly drizzle
in the broken sauce start slowly at
first just a few little chunks few
little drips when it starts to get a
little bit creamy you can see it coming
together you can dump more in and then
it really starts coming together and it
magically turns back into a hollandaise
it's unbelievable and then you can just
dump everything in whisk it up and then
to adjust your consistency you can add a
couple more drips of that hot water all
right just to you know I don't like a
really gloppy super thick hollandaise it
should flow over the eggs so I put a
couple drips of water in you may not
need that but anyway really quick simple
demo how to fix a broken hollandaise and
check it out unbelievable
in fact that's so awesome I think I will
break hollandaise in the future on
purpose
just so I could fix it just so it looks
that good hope you enjoyed that really
quick easy little simple trick and like
they say if it's broken
fix it visit the site food whooshes comm
for more info and as always enjoy
you
you
